entry.et: Middle English heep, from Old English hēap; akin to Old High German houf heap

def.dt: :a collection of things thrown one on another :pile
:to throw or lay in a heap :pile or collect in great quantity his sole object was to heap up riches
:to form or round into a heap heaped the dirt into a mound
:to form a heap on :load heavily heap the plates with food
:to accord or bestow lavishly or in large quantities heaped honors upon them
:the place where useless things are discarded
